section.hand:
To my L. T
re
r Sep
t
30 1591

addressleaf.section:
1591 30 Sep
t
To my L. Trea
s

page.lettertext:
May it please yo
r
good L. There is nothing yet don by
e
Councel
of state
in
e affaires of
Ostend,
for
t
the most of theyr colledge
have bin absent ever since & employed in commissions. I
writ as much unto
e
Governo
r
as I certefyed yo
r
L.
The
requesting somewhat from him in answere to
e point
objected by
the states. Howbeit he reputeth it needles. doing mee to wete,
that by a later letter w
ch
he receaved from
e states, they show,
that
e party w
ch
was sent from him unto them, hath satisfyed
th
e
in his behalf. What may be ment by that answere I
leave to yo
r
L. to consyder, having sent heerinclosed
e transcript
of that l
re
w
ch
was written fr
o
e States. Albeit I cannot
wonder, if many shift
be devised in a gainefull goverment, for
the winning of some time, yet the time hath bin to long, &
the dealing to offensive. Wh
r
of her
Ma
ty
I feare wil finde
e
inconvenience. For when that opinion is thoroly rooted, w
ch
hath bin planted long agoe in
e hart
of this people, that English
gentlemen come heth
r
to seek authority among them, not for any
love that they beare unto theyr cause, but to pray upon
e countrey
disesteeming the people, & all
e orders of theyr goverment, it
will growe in c
o
tinewance to so great a scandal, as when her
Ma
ty
would be
s
ved, we shall finde it very troublesome to
swade
them in any thing, to put any c
o
fidence in o
r
doing
. So
that
e Governo
r
will promise to answer
e countrey for all
his receit
: & conforme him self heerafter to
e orders of
e state
I do not dout but at last they will rest contented. For I see
they are bent to force him to account. & to tell yo
r
L. my conjecture
in case he shall refus it, or come to short of his reconing I
dout at length they will defalk it in discharge of those debt
w
ch
they owe unto her Ma
ty
. And this I write in respect of my
duty toward
her Hig
nes
, as also moved in conscience, for that I
see not any reason, nor coullor of any reason, that so
manifest a wrong should be offred
e country. Wherin notw
th
stan
ding as in all my actions & endevors, I submit my self
wholy to yo
r
L. correction.
& so I take &c. Sep
t
30 1591.
At
e earnest entreaty of
John Kighteley
the postm
r
for these
countreys, I cannot refuse to beseeche yo
r
L. in his behalf
for some favourable consyder
ao
n for his pai n es & expenses in the
carriage of my l
re
s, having had no allowance for any for
the space of 14 mo
th
es. I know no surer meanes for
e addresse
of my l
re
s then by him. But if yo
r
L. shall finde it an
unnecessarye charge. if yo
u
please to appoint mee to any other
in
London.
I will for heerafter alter my cowrse.
